The rules for computing the Hadamard product of two matrices are:

1. The matrices A and B must have the same dimensions (i.e., the same number of rows and columns).
2. The Hadamard product of A and B is a matrix where each element is the product of the corresponding elements in A and B.

Mathematically, the Hadamard product of two matrices A and B is denoted as A⊙B, and the element at the i-th row and j-th column of the resulting matrix is calculated as (A⊙B)_{i,j} = A_{i,j} \times B_{i,j}.

Applying these rules to the last question, the answer would be:

  5 & 6 \\
  7 & 8
\end{pmatrix}
\]
B =
\[
\begin{pmatrix}
  2 & 3 \\
  1 & 0
\end{pmatrix}
\]

A&B =
\[
\begin{pmatrix}
  5 \times 2 & 6 \times 3 \\
  7 \times 1 & 8 \times 0
\end{pmatrix}
=
\begin{pmatrix}
  10 & 18 \\
  7 & 0
\end{pmatrix}
\]
